Quizzicalweb app

ReactJS

GitHub Repo Live version

Quizzical is a web app that randomly pulls questions from the Open Table Database. The user selects their answers and then when submitting it will show them the correct answers as well as total how many they got correct. The majority of this project was built to practice {useState} and how to correctly setState when user input changes. There is also a bit of Conditional Rendering which is also effected by user input. The homepage utilizes Flexbox heavily for the layout. It was built as as one of the projects for Scrimba's Frontend Developer Career Path.

The most difficult part of this project is that much of the data was nested. The data object had nested arrays and objects for questions, correct answers, and other items not needed for my purpose. But, the bright side is I got a lot of practice with using spread operator to create new arrays or objects before setting state, which wasn't something I had done that often before this.

This project really gave me confidence that I was starting to understand ReactJS beyond just copy pasting the tutorials. There was no solution given to this project and I was determined that I wasn't going to give up until I solved it with all the features suggested.
